toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

items.blurb: Founded in 1889, University of Pikeville is a private institution. University of Pikeville follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

items.blurb: Founded in 1970, University of Puerto Rico--Ponce is a public institution.

institution.displayName: University of Science and Arts of Oklahoma

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1908, University of Science and Arts of Oklahoma is a public institution.

Founded in 1959, University of South Carolina--Beaufort is a public institution. University of South Carolina--Beaufort follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

items.blurb: Founded in 1991, University of the West is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1968, University of Wisconsin--Parkside is a public institution.
Founded in 1893, University of Wisconsin--Superior is a public institution. University of Wisconsin--Superior follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

items.blurb: Founded in 1865, Virginia Union University is a private institution. The school has 69.3% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Virginia Union University is 16:1.
Founded in 1961, Virginia Wesleyan University is a private institution.
Founded in 1941, Williams Baptist University is a private institution. Williams Baptist University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: During the fall 2015 admission cycle, 79 percent of international graduate applications came from Chinese and Indian nationals.
